document.masterDocTitle: Adamystis thailandensis sp. nov. (Acari: Prostigmata: Adamystidae), a new species of soil mites from Thailand with a key to world species of Adamystidae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Adamystis thailandensis sp. nov. (Acari: Prostigmata: Adamystidae), a new species of soil mites from Thailand with a key to world species of Adamystidae

heading.emphasis: Key to species of the family Adamystidae (females) of the World

subSubSection.paragraph:
This key is modified from
Ueckermann ( 1989 )

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Idiosoma constricted at level of coxae IV; dorsal shield divided; setae
d 2
and
e 2
present; cheliceral bases bulbous; more than 3 cheliceral setae present; fixed cheliceral digits developed; leg femora not subdivided … (subfamily Saxidrominae) .............................................................................................................................................................. 2

- Idiosoma not constricted at level of coxae IV; dorsal shield (if present) entire; setae
d 2
and
e 2
absent; cheliceral bases not bulbous; 1 or 2 cheliceral setae present; fixed cheliceral digits reduced; leg femora divided … (subfamily Adamystinae) ............................................................................................................................................................... 7

- Setae
f 2
and
h 3
present; trichobothria sci widely separated from each other............................................................... 5
3 . Idiosoma with 4 dorsal shields ( 3 transverse folds or striate bands present); 3 pairs of aggenital setae present ........ 4

- Idiosoma with 2 dorsal shields ( 1 transverse fold or striate band present); 4 pairs of aggenital setae present ..............
............................................................................................................................ Saxidromus delamarei
Coineau, 1974

4 . Setae
e 2
located on shield; coxal setation 3-4 - 4 - 4
.......................... Saxidromus anahoffmannea
Lopez-Campos, 1996

5 . Idiosoma with 3 dorsal shields ( 2 transverse folds or striate bands present); dorsum with circular depressions .......... ......................................................................................................................
Rhinodromus lootsi
Coineau et al. , 2006
- Idiosoma with 2 dorsal shields ( 1 transverse fold or striate band present); dorsum without circular depressions...... 6
7 . Lens-like structures present on idiosoma (at least on latero-supracoxal region).......................................................... 8
8 . Latero-supracoxal part of idiosoma with 1 or 2 pairs of lens-like structures ............................................................... 9
- Latero-supracoxal part of idiosoma with at least 8 pairs of lens-like structures ........................................................ 10

9 . One pair of lateral lens-like structures present (at level of setae vi ); dorsal shield reduced and smooth; setae
e 1
,
f 1
,
h 1-2
located on integument.
.......................................................................................... Adamystis fonsi
Coineau, 1974

- Two pairs of lateral lens-like structures present; dorsal shield extensively developed and reticulated; setae
e 1
,
f 1
,
h 1-
2 located on shield
............................................................................................ Adamystis buchelis
Ueckermann, 1989

- Lens-like structures present on posterior-dorsomedial idiosoma (between setal pairs
f 1
and
h 1
); dorsal shield densely striate.........................................................................................................................
Adamystis thailandensis
sp. nov.

11 . Dorsal shield punctuate; setae
h 1-2
located on shield ....................................
Adamystis oculeusis
Ueckermann, 1989

- Dorsal shield reticulated; setae
h 1-2
located on integument ....................
Adamystis sarae
Hunter and Crossley, 1968

- Dorsal shield absent; palpal tarsus shorter than femurogenu
................................ Adamystis nudis
Ueckermann, 1989

- Setae
f 1
located on integument
..................................................... Adamystis beckyanneae
McDaniel and Bolen, 1983

- Four pairs of aggenital setae present, most located on integument; 2 small ventral shields present and situated anter- olateral to genital opening
..................................................................... Adamystis monomaculata
Ueckermann, 1989

- Dorsal shield smooth; coxal shields confined to level of coxa IV
............................. Adamystis donnae
Cunliffe, 1957
17 . Chelicera with 1 seta; dorsal shield without circular depressions (vacuoles) dorsomedially .................................... 18

19 . Setae
h 2
and
ps 1-3
located on reticulate platelets
................................................. Adamystis yvesi
Ueckermann, 1989

- Setae
h 2
and
ps 1-3
located on integument
........................................................... Adamystis doumengei
Coineau, 1974
